name: Sumit Kumar Rai
about: Sumit is a Sr. Data Engineer in CloudFactory who respects people and has experience in building an enterprise data warehouse, automating workflows, and tackling challenging architectural with scalability problems. He has a total of 8 years of IT career: 2 years as Software Developer, 4 years as DevOps Engineer, and 2 years as Data Engineer. With this wide scope of experience, he meets the business objectives, has best practices for quality work, and can troubleshoot tough technical problems.

responsibilities: Was awarded recognition for working dedicatedly on different pieces of work in the data team and being the pillar for the team.
Lead on moving all the data pipelines existing in Xplenty to Prefect orchestration due to the lower return value compared to the cost spent.
Had enforced documentation and testing in the team to achieve 80% above to meet the organization's goals of building a self-service BI platform.
Had written transformations in DBT following the Kimball approach and ensured the complete, accurate, and timely data.
Had built a CI pipeline from scratch in GitHub actions to have quick feedback to the data model source contributors.
Implemented the SQL standard strictly in the projects by introducing SQLfluff and automatically evaluating the quality of the SQL using GitHub actions.
Loaded the data sources into the enterprise data warehouse using ETL/ELT tools and scripts.
Orchestrated data pipelines using Prefect that existed in EC2 so that we have centralized logging and proper visibility of the pipeline runs.
Created and managed the SnowFlake objects: databases(catalogs), schemas, tables, views, stages, snowpipes, masks, and tasks.
Was awarded recognition for showing dedication towards increasing the availability and stability of a critical communication microservice application from 95% to 99%.
Had reduced the startup time of the AutoScaling EC2 instances by 70% by replacing on-load executable ansible scripts into Hashicorp packer.
Wrote optimized SQL queries to process big data and get ultimate results to make proper business decisions.
Troubleshot and resolved issues among many apps to support the ongoing platform development in dev, test, and production environments.
Monitored the operation of the applications and also enhanced their performance.
Updated and upgraded legacy infrastructure to support business operations.
Worked collaboratively with software engineering teams to meet the Scrum sprint goals.
Developed python and Ansible scripts to configure EC2 infrastructures.
Constructed the Jenkins pipeline for automated deployments of the source code.
Designed and structured the Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources with Auto Scaling and Elastic Load Balancers via CloudFormation; configure and troubleshoot them as well.
Engineered, implemented, and monitored security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks, and information.
Setup and configured pfSense firewall for the Intranet; configured traffic shaping for suitable working environments, VPN (OpenVPN), IPS (Snort), web filter (Squid), and more.
Setup identity managers using both FreeIPA and Active Directory to centralize the identities of the employees.
Responsible for looking after DNS records and SSL certificates for the clientsâ€™ accounts as well as the entities.
